alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 4:44AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Custer County through 530 AM CDT... At 443 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mason City, or 23 miles southeast of Broken Bow, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ansley, Mason City, Block Hill Basin, Gavin Siding, Intersection of Highway 183 and Cumro Road and Cumro. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 73 and 90. Highway 2 between mile markers 296 and 307. Highway 92 between mile markers 300 and 308. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
